title: Ticket #3772: Nested ads can't be printed in old ClassAd syntax
description:
Nested ClassAds aren't printed properly when unparsed in the old ClassAd syntax. A nested ad can be represented in the old ClassAd syntax like so: 
B = [ Y = true; Z = "Foo"; X = 3 ]

However, when this gets parsed and unparsed in the old syntax, it ends up looking like this: 

B = Y = true
Z = "Foo"
X = 3

Attributes Z and X end up in the top-level ad and attribute B won't parse correctly, since "Y = true" isn't a valid attribute value.

The unparser should be modified so that when in old ClassAd mode, any nested ads are printed using the new ClassAd syntax. That is, enclosing the ad in square brackets and using semicolons to separate attributes.
remarks:
2013-Jul-16 15:37:17 by jfrey:
A proper fix for this bug requires adding a boolean to the ClassAdUnParser class, so that it can track whether it's in a nested ad during unparsing. Normally, this would change the ClassAd API in a way requiring a bump in the SO version, which we shouldn't do in a stable series. But in this case, we can add the bool without changing the size of the ClassAdUnParser object or the layout of existing data members. The class currently contains 3 one-byte members. Memory alignment results in at least one more byte of unused space. It should be safe to fix this bug in the 8.0 stable series without changing the so library version.

2014-Mar-04 19:55:02 by bbockelm:
Hi,

Can this be backported to stable series? This one broke HTCondor-CE, which uses sub-classads :(

Brian

2014-Apr-17 14:40:41 by jfrey:
The fix has been back-ported to 8.0.7.
